step1.sentence: Launching a new product in an untested market is a calculated risk, but the potential rewards make it worthwhile.

step2.story: Maya quit her stable job to open a bakery downtown. It was a calculated risk—she had saved enough to survive a year without profit. Six months later, the shop was fully booked every weekend.

step3.story: After years of working for someone else, Daniel decided to invest his savings in a small tech startup. Everyone around him called it reckless, but he saw it as a calculated risk—he had spent months researching the market, studying the founders, and mapping out worst-case scenarios. He knew he might lose everything, but he also knew he had done his homework. When the startup landed its first major client three months later, Daniel felt not just relief but a quiet confidence. Taking that calculated risk had taught him more about himself than a decade of playing it safe ever could.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: 결과와 가능성을 충분히 검토하고 의도적으로 감수하는 위험.
meaning.realUsageKo: 무모한 도박이 아니라 충분한 정보와 판단을 바탕으로 의식적으로 선택한 위험 부담을 표현할 때 사용한다. 비즈니스, 투자, 진로 결정 등 다양한 상황에서 쓰인다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 'calculated'는 라틴어 'calculare(계산하다)'에서 유래했으며, '미리 신중하게 따져본'이라는 의미를 더한다. 'risk'는 이탈리아어 'risco(암초, 위험)'에서 왔다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 단순한 위험(risk)과 달리 사전 분석과 준비가 전제된 긍정적인 뉘앙스를 지닌다. 무모함이 아닌 전략적 용기를 강조하는 표현이다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: Investing in the new technology was a calculated risk that paid off.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 신기술에 투자하는 것은 계산된 위험이었고, 결국 성과를 거뒀다.
